qas.question: Who has stirred controversy for development and design of Chelsea Barracks?
What family was funding the development of former Chelsea Barracks?
What new library illustrates the traditional style of neoclassicism?

answers.text: Quinlan Terry's Maitland Robinson Library at Downing College

qas.question: What is the name of the library that illustrates the unconventional style of neoclassical?
Is neoclassical design current in Britain?

answers.text: a number of architects are active in the neoclassical

qas.question: What country has a number of architects active in the Roman Greco style?
What architectural style is always traditional?
Who promoted a modern design for development on the former Chelsea barracks?

plausible_answers.text: development on the land of the former Chelsea Barracks in London.

qas.question: What building project was being funded by the British Royal family?

context: In <b5_0>Britain<b5_0/> <a4_0>a number of architects are active in the <b6_0>neoclassical<b6_0/><a4_0/> style. Two new university Libraries, <a2_0>Quinlan Terry's Maitland Robinson Library at Downing College<a2_0/> and <a3_0>ADAM Architecture's Sackler Library<a3_0/> illustrate that the approach taken can range from the traditional, in the former case, to the unconventional, in the latter case. Recently, <a0_0><b7_0>Prince Charles<b7_0/><a0_0/> came under controversy for promoting a classically designed <b8_0>development on the land of the former Chelsea Barracks in London.<b8_0/> Writing to the <a1_0>Qatari Royal family<a1_0/> (who were funding the development through the property development company Qatari Diar) he condemned the accepted modernist plans, instead advocating a classical approach. His appeal was met with success and the plans were withdrawn. A new design by architecture house Dixon Jones is currently being drafted.
